etymology.description: Depicts fetus 巳(巳) (sì, "fetus") in womb 勹(勹) (bāo, "wrap") -> swaddled baby -> wrap
etymology.interpretation: The character 包(bāo) visually represents a fetus enclosed in the womb, akin to wrapping. This imagery conveys the concept of enveloping or wrapping something securely.

examples.chinese: 妈妈正在包饺子(媽媽正在包餃子)。
她学习如何包礼物(她學習如何包禮物)，让它看起来更漂亮(讓它看起來更漂亮)。
examples.pinyin: tā xuéxí rúhé bāo lǐwù, ràng tā kàn qǐlái gèng piàoliang.
examples.english: She learns how to wrap gifts to make them look more beautiful.

examples.chinese: 厨师熟练地包春卷(廚師熟練地包春捲)，确保每一个都紧紧地包着(確保每一個都緊緊地包著)。
examples.pinyin: chúshī shúliàn de bāo chūnjuǎn, quèbǎo měi yīgè dōu jǐn jǐn de bāozhe.
examples.english: The chef skillfully wraps spring rolls, ensuring each one is tightly wrapped.
